body:
Since https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/pull/79 was merged, you should be able to copy or bookmark the URL and resume editing at that page (see screenshot below).

[![Screenshot showing offset state in URL](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/51856321-6e0e1e00-22fd-11e9-8420-1204b8a3d3b7.png)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/51856321-6e0e1e00-22fd-11e9-8420-1204b8a3d3b7.png)

Related issues: https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/84, https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/58.

@icoxfog417 @Hironsan Given that this feature request comes up regularly, would you be interested in reconsidering an approach like what was proposed in https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/pull/195?

issue.title: Feature Request: Go to specific page

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
# Feature request

Thanks for a great tool, feels really promising and is fast to work with. 

However for me it is really lacking a feature to go to a specific page when annotating a sequence. Say that I have 2000 sequences I want to annotate with entities, if I want to go back to sequence 1000 I have to manually go through each page. This is time consuming and somewhat error prone as one might miss to annotate some sequences.

issue.title: Bookmarks/skip forward to next unviewed text

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Related to these two issues
https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/310
https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/14

It would be great to have the notion of a text having been 'seen' not just annotated and then skip to next 'unseen' (by any annotator on the project, or by given user) bit of text.

The reason is we can have large amounts of text which legitimately have no annotations and I don't want to have to keep going over those, rather I want to sort by ones that have been seen by at least one person.

Thanks,
Z

issue.title: Jump to page or document

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
Currently it looks like I have to go through all pages/documents sequentially to get to where I want to be. Unless I'm missing something. Also the buttons for next/previous document/page jump around depending on text length so it slows down how fast I can get to the page I want.

It would also be nice if the previous document/page button would wrap around to the end of the document list.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

body:
From other related issues, I think there are 2 points of request.

* Want to ignore non-related data (ex. [don't have an annotation target](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/58#issuecomment-458114329) or [already checked data](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/384)).
* [Bookmark the data](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/310)

I think it will be hard to remember the number of pages.  It'll be partial feature to resolve user needs.
Actually, resume feature has already been supported.

issue.title: Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
Currently, I can locate the annotated documents with offset variable in the formatted url, http://demo.herokuapp.com/projects/1/#offset=.  It works in the same session but it fails if I log out because the documents are in randomized order .

Could you please tell me how to locate document by id  from the url like  demo.herokuapp.com/projects/1/#**docid**=?
